profile.name: Deva Sai Kumar Bheesetti
profile.summary: Full‑stack software engineer & AI/ML engineer with ~5 years combined experience (3 industry + 2 research). Strong in Python/JS, FastAPI, AWS, Docker/K8s, LLMs (Hugging Face, Longformer, LLaMA), and Pega Decisioning (CSSA, CPDC). MS CS at UMass Lowell (GPA 3.94).

qa.a: AI/ML Engineer, Data Scientist, and Full‑Stack/SDE roles building LLM features, APIs, and analytics systems.

qa.q: Give a one‑line summary of yourself.
qa.a: Full‑stack & AI engineer (MS CS, GPA 3.94) with 3 yrs industry + 2 yrs research; I build reliable APIs, LLM pipelines, and data automations.
Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, SQL, Java; working knowledge of R and C++.
AWS (S3, EC2, Lambda, SageMaker), Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions/Jenkins, CI/CD.
PyTorch, Transformers (Hugging Face), Longformer, LLaMA 3.x/DeepSeek, LangChain, CUDA, Captum explainability.

qa.q: Best academic metric from your thesis?
qa.a: 92.6% ±1 accuracy with MAE 0.235 for multi‑label ordinal SDoH prediction on opioid‑related clinical notes.

qa.q: What did you lead at Verizon?
qa.a: The core Publish Module in Pega Decisioning/CDH for offer creation/validation/deployment; designed REST integrations and agent/queue‑processor automations.
Improved system throughput by ~20% via optimized queue processors and async orchestration in Verizon's Pega Decisioning Hub.
Reduced model inference latency ~30% using CUDA optimization and dynamic batching for transformer pipelines.
Engineered ETL/data flows and built dashboards (Tableau/Power BI), integrating Sheets/SQL and automation with Apps Script.
Airflow, Kafka, ETL pipelines, AWS Glue patterns, data warehousing concepts.
A GPT‑based advising assistant integrated with student data; fine‑tuned BERT regressors, automated grading with Dockerized CI scripts.
Entropy‑based sampling to pick uncertain clinical notes for re‑annotation; improved model calibration and data quality.
Token‑level attributions with Captum; clinician review loops to validate model decisions.
CSSA, CPDC (also CSA earlier).
PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL; some MongoDB/Firebase.
FastAPI for clean, typed APIs and async performance.
Time‑series forecasting with LSTM/Prophet, anomaly alerts with AWS SNS, dashboards in Streamlit/Grafana.
Fine‑tuned CodeLLaMA/DeepSeek‑Coder to analyze PRs via GitHub Actions; generated targeted comments.
LangChain + Chroma with local docs; Streamlit UI; private/offline Q&A over notes/PDFs.
Led 4‑member onshore/offshore team at Verizon; mentored students/peers; coordinated with architects and clinicians.
Blend of enterprise Pega Decisioning ownership and modern LLM/ML engineering; I deliver reliable systems end‑to‑end.
Yes; remote or hybrid are also fine.
devasai1259@gmail.com | +1 (978) 942-1632 | Lowell, MA

qa.q: Tell me about your OurFreedom.ai role.
qa.a: Full‑stack engineer architecting social networking features (follow/block/privacy), voice SDK integration, and content moderation using NestJS, MongoDB, React Native.

qa.q: What performance improvements did you achieve at OurFreedom.ai?
qa.a: Reduced profile loading time by 60% through optimized data fetching and eliminated 95% of support tickets via automated registration hooks.
AI‑powered symptom checker with Next.js/React Native, NestJS backend, Supabase PostgreSQL with pgvector RAG, providing evidence‑backed medical triage using OpenAI/Gemini LLMs.

qa.q: What privacy features did you build?
qa.a: Complete social graph system with follow/block/private profiles, row‑level security policies, and privacy‑aware APIs ensuring 99.9% uptime and zero security incidents.
Implemented Twilio Voice SDK integration with JWT token management, fixed authentication flows, and enabled concurrent voice communication for thousands of users.
Multi‑label ordinal modeling for Social Determinants of Health prediction from 2,636 opioid clinical notes using Clinical Longformer, CORN heads, and CEM‑ORD hybrid loss.
Entropy‑based sampling selected top‑100 uncertain samples for re‑annotation, improving rare‑class calibration and model confidence.
Token‑level attributions via Captum Integrated Gradients and LIME, with clinician review loops validating predictions for healthcare interpretability.
Clinical Longformer, DeepSeek‑R1, LLaMA 3.2 for healthcare NLP; BERT regressors for academic analysis; CodeLLaMA/DeepSeek‑Coder for code review.
Achieved 92.6% ±1 ordinal accuracy, 82.4% exact match vs. clinician annotations, MAE 0.235; advanced biomedical NLP for opioid care decision support.
Reduced manual workload by 70% through FastAPI + Apps Script automations, automated grading, and data‑driven event planning dashboards.
Managed web/data ops for 100+ speakers using Tridion SDL, Tableau Prep, Google Apps Script; automated reporting, scraped data with Selenium, enhanced images with RealESRGAN.
Built pipelines using instruction‑tuned LLMs for alumni data, Selenium for speaker details, BeautifulSoup for AACSB forms; integrated with Google Sheets/Apps Script.
MURA X‑ray abnormality detection (DenseNet201/VGG16 with GradCAM), fall detection with RGB‑Pose on Raspberry Pi, RealESRGAN image enhancement for events.
NeuroHandSim: real‑time EEG signal processing from MUSE sensors, deep learning gesture classification, 3D hand simulation control for assistive technology.
Built 8 React Native/Expo screens (settings, blocked users, profile actions), VitaScan mobile app, optimistic UI with Zustand, Expo Router navigation.
NestJS microservices with dependency injection, FastAPI typed APIs, REST/SOAP integrations, MongoDB aggregations, PostgreSQL with pgvector RAG.
Docker‑based CI scripts for grading automation, GitHub Actions/Jenkins pipelines, test coverage maintenance, Linux server deployments, Vercel/Render hosting.
Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, Streamlit, Grafana; built predictive dashboards and real‑time monitoring systems.
Designed REST/SOAP APIs for Pega‑Oracle sync, ReactJS‑Pega Hub integrations, Twilio Voice endpoints, content moderation, and report logging systems.
Kibana utilities for API logging/debugging, Grafana dashboards, AWS SNS anomaly alerts, unified logging across custom/OOB APIs.
Resolved critical outages including rule‑class mismatches after Pega upgrades, managed high‑pressure incidents, coordinated with Verizon architects on error handling.
Supported agile operations, deployments, pipeline config; led PR reviews, task assignments, unblocked teammates, maintained branch stability across repos.
30% productivity gain via Pega declarative rules/agents/schedulers; 70% manual reduction with GPT+Selenium for AACSB forms; automated offer migration workflows.
Implemented pgvector in Supabase for medical knowledge retrieval (CDC/WHO/NHS), LangChain+Chroma for personal knowledge Q&A over notes/PDFs.
Instruction fine‑tuning for Discord bot RAG, web scraping, code review; CORN heads for ordinal regression; BERT for academic regressors.
MS Computer Science, UMass Lowell (GPA 3.94, Aug 2023–Aug 2025); BTech ECE, K L University (GPA 3.52, 2016–2020).
F‑1 OPT started September 15, 2025; authorized to work in the US.
CSSA, CPDC, CSA (Pega); IBM Data Science Professional; Google IT Automation with Python; Applied AI (Hugging Face); AWS Cloud Practitioner CLF‑C02 Cert Prep.
Promoted twice within two years at Infosys: Associate Business Analyst (Dec 2020–Aug 2022) → Technology Analyst Module Lead (Aug 2022–Aug 2023).

LSTM/Prophet models for AIOps monitoring with anomaly detection, predictive attendance dashboards for Industry Days events.

Row‑level security in Supabase, JWT authentication, privacy‑aware visibility controls, auto‑unfollow on block, HIPAA‑aligned data protection.
POST /api/posts/:id/report endpoint with self‑report prevention, 500‑char reason validation, admin review logging, and privacy controls.
Built error‑handling utilities with Verizon architects, fixed Twilio token expiration/race conditions, robust validation preventing edge cases.
pnpm workspaces for VitaScan monorepo, GitHub Actions CI/CD, Vercel/Render deployments, Docker containerization.
Fixed routing issues, removed debug buttons/mock data, integrated LinearGradient components, SafeAreaView optimizations for native mobile.
TypeScript across NestJS/React Native, type‑safe API responses, proper profile population, eliminated 'Unknown User' issues.
Generated synthetic samples from informative tokens to handle class imbalance in SDoH prediction for rare ordinal categories.
Achieved 0.72 IAA with clinicians on SDoH annotations; validated model decisions through review loops.
CUDA acceleration for transformer pipelines, dynamic batching reducing inference latency by ~30%, optimized long‑context models.
Ensemble ML model with RGB‑Pose for fall detection, deployed to Raspberry Pi with AWS SNS email notifications for safety monitoring.
RealESRGAN for upscaling low‑resolution event photos, GradCAM visualizations for X‑ray abnormality interpretability.
